medical_history.chief_complaint: Complete paralysis of the left mandibular branch of the facial nerve and paresthesias in the tongue following abdominal liposuction.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms began the day after the procedure with complete paralysis of the left mandibular branch and complaints of paresthesias in the tongue. No oral trauma or pressure was reported during the 1-hour procedure.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient had a tick bite 2 months prior to the procedure with subsequent erythema consistent with erythema migrans. Laboratory evaluation for Lyme disease revealed a weakly positive ELISA and a negative Western blot exam.
medical_history.social_history: The patient is a naturalist who works in a tick-infested area of a nature preserve.
